application_type_full: Prior Approval: Change of use from Commercial, Business and Service (Use Class E) to Dwellinghouses (Use Class C3)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be completed before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and condition 5 of Schedule 2, Part 3, Class MA of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 as amended. | The building permitted to be used as a dwellinghouse by virtue of Class MA shall remain in use as a dwellinghouse within the meaning of Class C3 of Schedule 1 to the Use Classes Order and for no other purpose, except to the extent that the other purpose is ancillary to the use as a dwellinghouse.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and condition 6 of Schedule 2, Part 3, Class MA of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 as amended. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings / document title number(s): 151-153UXBR-LP01 (SITE AND LOCATION PLAN); 36VICA-PP02 (EXISTING AND PROPOSED PLANS); PLANNING STATEMENT
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage, in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards, has been provided and has been fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.

Reason: In the interests of the adequate disposal, storage and collection of waste and recycling in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy SI 8 of the London Plan (2021), the NPPF (2023) and the Ealing Council Waste management guidelines for architects and developers document. | Cycle storage for a minimum of 3 bicycles, shall be provided onsite in accordance with all adopted standards prior to occupation of the proposed residential units and be continuously available and retained for the life of the development hereby approved. Cycle storage shall be secure and covered.
Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with Sustainable Transport SPG and policy T5 of the London Plan (2021).

| Prior to commencement of the development, a noise assessment report shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of external noise sources industrial/ commercial/ cultural/transport uses and their noise levels occurring at the site during most of the year, ie. measured during school and work weekdays, in accordance with internal noise limits specified in BS8233:2014 and including the aircraft noise data in Section 6, SPG10 (worst mode aircraft 1-day noise contour predicted for 2016 (57dB). Details shall include the sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing specifications (laboratory tested including frames, seals and any integral ventilators, approved in accordance with BS EN ISO 10140-2:2010) and of acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building and details of self-noise). Best practicable mitigation measures shall also be implemented, as necessary, in external amenity spaces to achieve criteria of BS8233:2014. The approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with Policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), Policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), Policy D14 of The London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).
| The part of the building permitted to be used as a dwelling by virtue of Class MA shall be permanently occupied by no more than 4 persons.
Reason: In order to comply with the Technical housing standards - nationally described space standard (2015).
description: Change of use from second floor offices (Use Class E) to one self-contained residential unit (Use Class C3) (Class MA, 56 day Prior Approval Process)
